title.@value: Congenital non-inherited pure red cell aplasia

definition.@value: A condition caused by determinates arising during the antenatal period, leading to a change in the formation of erythrocytes. This condition is characterised by maturation arrest occuring in the formation of erythrocytes. This condition may present with severe anaemia. Confirmation is by identification of decreased levels of red blood cells in a blood sample.

label.@value: Congenital non-inherited pure red cell aplasia
